thread.title: Lorna Cooper feeds family on £16.60 weekly budget | Metro News
thread.title_full: Lorna Cooper feeds family on £16.60 weekly budget | Metro News

author: Ashitha Nagesh For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Lorna Cooper feeds family on £16.60 weekly budget | Metro News
text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 9:19 am Pretty good (Picture: Facebook) 
For some, feeding your family for around 62p a portion sounds like the dream. 
But Lorna Cooper has managed to cut down the overall weekly food cost by buying everything in bulk ahead of time. 
Then, to prevent food waste, she freezes any leftovers they have. Tube and rail strikes continue to cause commuter choas 
She claims that, as a result, her food budget is only around £16.60 a week for her family of four. 
Lorna apparently gets a £65 box from Muscle Food , an online food shop, which lasts her family for around six weeks. 
While the box is only made up of meat, she also orders vegetables and cupboard staples from the site. Impressive (Picture: Facebook) 
To save even more money, however, you could get a fresh veg hamper for £10 a week for four people – which works out around £5 cheaper every six weeks than if you buy the meat one. You could then supplement your order with grains and spices. Brace yourselves! Storm Doris is going to hit with blizzards with 80mph winds 
Lorna, from Blocharin in Glasgow, said: ‘I’ve always watched what I’ve spent when it comes to the grocery bill, and over the years have learnt a lot of different ways to make meals stretch further. 
‘I’ve definitely learnt that bulk-ordering wholesome and healthy ingredients instead of regular trips to the shop is a great way to prep ahead and make food last.’ 
She also runs a Facebook page called ‘ Feed your family for about £20 a week ‘, or ‘FYF’ for short, on which she gives regular money-saving advice and recipes. More
